description: A nice app for the initial import of the photos from the camera. Doesn't mutate the RAW files and therefore can easily be supplemented with a more advanced RAW processing tool.

Fast, reliable, good functionality and still improving. Love it.
Works well with an external photo library on usb drive.
This is the least intuitive software I've ever used. You will have to invest considerable time just to learn very simple editing with this software.

I like that it makes it really easy to import photos from camera and automatically organizes them in folders by dates.

Sometimes I don't want or need a complex full of features image manager, I just want my pics on my computer, in a way I can easily find them, and Shotwell does it.

Shotwell is a great application to sort and view your photo collection.

It would be even more usefull if there was some kind of web integration.

It doesn't recognize my camera, but it still refuses to give up trying to open it. No matter how many times you tell it to buzz off and never try again.
Uninstalling to have some peace and quiet.

good 

This would be a whole lot better if it had some kind of 'Sharpen' tool. Google's Picasa had a very simple one that was easy to use and was standard equipment on PIcasa. Someone who knows how should load something like that to Shotwell.
Opening a shotwell viewer for even a single file slowly ramps up the memory consumed until it uses all of the computer's memory.
no copy ability

Organizes photos well and provides needed editing features in a non-destructive way. If you have camera problems, just copy your photos over and then import (with copy) them and delete the copy you moved over.

Simple tasks, such as adding/removing tags for multiple photo's are made overly complicated.
Sometimes, existing hierarchical tags are 'added' to the basic tags, and it takes a lot of slowly going work to put them in place again. (If you have a tag like 'People/friends/John', a loose tag 'John' appears.)
Random comments are literally changed into Chinese characters for no apparent reason. Sometimes the title changes into the comment.
The program is slow, bothersome and annoying, but I have not found a replacement yet. I was used to F-Spot and would change back without thinking.
check out gThumb, it is pretty.
summary: It's okay, but gThumb is so cool

description: It is good and easy to view image.
Could you please make it so you can zoom in when cropping. Thanks. Other than that it's awesome.

Shotwell tries to copy every image into its own library. That makes it unusable, because I have terabytes of photographs from many years of photography. I already have my photographs arranged the way that I want them, and do not need shotwell copying them all into its own library.
And there isn't even enough spare disk space.

Every time that I fire up Shotwell, it scans 10 hard drives and then tries to copy every image, which would take hours. And shotwell isn't usable until it finishes that busywork. So shotwell is unusable.

I have tried to uninstall shotwell but that destroys the GUI because some fool decided to make Shotwell a critical part of the GUI. It totally dismantles KDE or GNOME when I uninstall Shotwell. I learned that one the hard way and had to reinstall the operating system to fix things. Very bad system design there. Shotwell is not a necessary part of the system. It is not even a desired part.

Shotwell would not be so bad if it had a setting where I could tell it, "Leave all images in place where you find them. Just build a list of the photos that you find so that you can display or manipulate them in place." Actually, I don't even want Shotwell to manipulate images. GIMP is much much better for that. So I don't need or want Shotwell and would uninstall it if someone had not hardwired it into the GUI.
ffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff

great app for simple (very simple) photo managment, basic or watered down version of google pisca. requires easy option to update, instructions to update confusing - its 2020 not 1960, make deb files not mind mending update instructions

As a long time Mac user who switched full time to Ubuntu more than a year ago, replacing Apple Photos was one of my last hurdles. 

Shotwell imported my Photos library of over 25,000 images and 95% were correctly sorted by year/month/day. The only exceptions were several hundred old family photos I scanned. Apple Photos did not embed my revised dates in the EXIF data, do I had to re-date all those photos in Shotwell (which does change the actual EXIF data.)

 One gripe: I do not like installing Snaps and Flatpaks, so I wish I didn't have to wait so long for a DEB of the newest versions.
summary: Excellent full featured app that's easy to use

description: i like it T its nice for edit pics after screanshot

My only problem is that when i try to make a slide show of two or more pictures my background goes black. Please fix this

I'm running Ubuntu 20.04 LTS
Is a nice low performance editor, but crashes too often, unfortunately
summary: Is a nice low performance editor, but crashes too often, unfortunately

description: It is a good quick photo enhancer, better than MS windows photo viewer i used. It has all the basic tools.
summary: simple, quick and easy photo enhance

description: I like that it makes really easy to import photos from camera and automatically organizes them in folders by dates
Well the Photo manager is up to expectation but more better can be deliver.
Tons of crashes, can't scroll through photos, low useability
summary: Tons of crashes, can't scroll through photos, low useability

description: Removed all my files without permission.

Great App but lack the ability to display GIFs in animated form.
Something to think about perhaps ?

A very simple way to slightly alter your pictures, it doesn't replace photoshop but it doesn't need to!
I use it basically to crop, turn and automatically adjust pictures that don't need deeper editing, and it avoids me opening heavier and more complex programs.
It's great for THAT.
If photoshop is needed for a picture... let's use photoshop and not expect a lightweight program like this does the trick ^_^
Just a great application to use on my chromebook. I highly recommend it for Chromebook since LR isn't available for Chromebook but with shotwell it's a time saving great personal librarian.
summary: Finally a program that helps me so much on my chromebook

description: WARNING erased all my photos without warning not only in file but also in device stay away from this piece of junk WARNING
RAW processing is better than windows photos, and has more features. It's literally free, what's to complain about?
summary: Works well for editing, especially raws

description: I can't install. Everytime I try to install it says dependencies are not met, but it doesn't tell me what those dependencies are.
Great app, would recommend.
The app looks good, yet I unable to use it for my photos in JPEG2000 and CR3 formats. Basically it does not work for me, and I'm discouraged.
summary: Can't use it because it does not support JPEG2000

description: But it's also very slow at loading images in the cloud
But 4/5 because of wallpapers are cropped

I work on a Mac for work. Photos is part of the job for organizing reference. I tried Windows 10 and the have NO GOOD way to deal with images, not close to something as simple and user friendly has Apple Photos. This weekend I wiped Windows 10 and installed Ubuntu, then I found Showtwell, PERFECT. Nearly identical to Photos. Love it. Who knows, perhaps Apple was copying the layout of Shotwell for all I know. Either way this UI is simple yet refined. Just what I need.
Caused Q4OS to crash 3 times, naturally removed!
Excelent to organize photos and simple editing.
Fast and easy to use.

On my Android föne I use SD card as Camera app storage. Thus the "photograph transfer" tränsfer möde is useles, because shotwell does not check for other than internal storage.

Any wäy to fïx thöet?
tried to use this app to download pics from my Kodak digital and it doesn't recognize the pictures , it won't give the preview and will NOT import anything
summary: absolute junk won't operate with my camera

description:
thanks for the job, very useful app.
Could you make the interface and the fucntionality more like of FastStone Image viewer. Linux users are waiting for FastStone analog for years.
by the way i can't see all folders, only home/ubuntu/pictures/, but it has no access to e.g. home/ubuntu/download/
Thanks.
Freezes when you ask it to import from a mobile phone
crashes as soon as I try to launch and lick on any menu! I see someone else wrote the same issue. Feedback cnnt monitored by them or youd think they would FIX IT.
summary: crashes on launch when I click on any menu to do anything

description:
When opening a big folder of images, it consumes 100% of CPU and RAM, including the swap.
Then, it freezes
high CPU usage on ubuntu 22

Doesnt even support for lot of images
having issues in opening DSLR or small camera images, please fix it

I really like this app and am very grateful to the developers for it. It runs perfectly on my Debian 12 setup, installed from the repo. I previously installed as flatpak but could not open images in external editor or RAW editor, so settled for the Debian package despite being an older version.
Very usable and effective for browsing and tagging images and videos for my personal library and I also prefer using it for my creative photography because it is so clear and legible and fast to navigate. Integrates perfectly with my system and no jankiness whatsoever upon install. The only major improvement I would like to see is writing tag metadata to video files to make them more portable and futureproof, although I understand that might be a big ask. Great work and thanks again.

Ich benutze das Programm um alle meine kurzen Videos für YouTube zu erstellen. Da sind auch mal 5-10 Video/Bilderspuren und mehrere Audiospuren nötig. Ich mag die umfangreichen Effektmöglichkeiten für Video und Audio. Und Abstüze kommen praktisch nicht vor. Ich muss bei Effekt-Animationen aber immer wieder herumprobieren, wie das funktioniert.
summary: Funktioniert prima, aber nicht ganz einfach zu bedienen

description: versuche seit 2 Woche Bilder zu importieren, kein Erfolg!!!
mir gefällt die App sehr weil man kann dort aus sehr langweiligen Fotos sehr coole Fotos machen kann.Und dort gibt es keine Werbung und was ich auch toll finde ist das dort alles kostenlos ist.

Seit den Anfängen von Picasa war ich nicht mehr so glücklich mit einer einzigen Photoanwendung. Shotwell bietet den perfekten Kompromiss zwischen Einfachheit und Features. 

Leider ist es mit meinem alten PC mit dem Anstieg der Fotosammlung auf über 100.000 Bilder unerträglich langsam im Startup-Scan geworden, der sich auch nicht deaktivieren läßt. Es liegt vermutlich an den vielen Videos in den Bilderordnern, mit denen Shotwell nicht klar kommt. Bin notgedrungen auf Digikam umgestiegen, das schon zu viele Features hat und nicht so zum Genießen der Bilder einlädt, wie es bei Shotwell der Fall ist.
summary: Vermutliche die beste Photoverwaltung unter Linux

description:
Smartphone wird nicht eingelesen, weil die"Kamera von einer anderen Anwendung reserviert" wird.

Lösung: Im Dateimanager das Smartphone aushängen - voila :/

Ich stand heute vor der schwierigen Aufgabe, von 4 verschiedenen Datenquellen mehrere tausend(!) Fotos und diverse andere Bilder auf ein neues Medium zu synchronisieren und in ordentliche Verzeichnisstrukturen zu bekommen. Nach 13(!) Versuchen habe ich die Nase voll. Immer wieder brach der Vorgang ab. Ich nutze nun XnView MP. Proprietär, aber läuft.
Gute alternative zum altem iPhoto für Linux! Einfache Bedienung, shöne dunkle Oberfläche!

Der Verwaltungsteil ist ziemlich enttäuschend: keine Unterstützung von WebP, ungenutzte Tags muss man wohl per Hand ermitteln und löschen, Duplikate werden nicht erkannt, wenn man Meta-Informationen in der Datei speichert, ...

Vielleicht sind die Bearbeitungsmöglichkeiten wirklich toll, aber dafür benutze ich einen Editor und keinen Manager.
summary: Macht alles irgendwie, aber nicht gut

description: Cruel - why it is nearly impossible to remove it with packet manager?
Macht, was es soll.
hola soy meguto
Es una de las mejores opciones que he probado para GNU/Linux, tiene muchas opciones y también la posibilidad de retocar las fotos con un click.
This program wastes a huge amount of storage space when you import RAW files. To make matters worse, I can't rate with less than two stars.

Hace un par de años le habría dado 5 estrellas, pero creo que la han descuidado un poco. Me agrada mucho porque me ayuda a gestionar mis fotografías y puede importar de manera automática desde la cámara, sin embargo los complementos que permitían exportar a flicker por ejemplo, se han quedado obsoletos.
summary: Una excelente aplicación venida a menos

description: se detiene, las imagenes demoran en abrir, al presionar guardar no se cierra la pantall. hace que mi computadora de tilde
Muy util, funciona perfecto
se bloquea la ventana en la que ejecuta y no deja ver nada detras de ella incluso despues de haber cerrado el programa
Buena herramienta para quienes necesitamos funciones básicas.
Es practico y fácil de usar . Recomendable !!
Debería de tener más opciones de personalización, y creo que debería de contar con clasificación por caras, como la galeria de Windows o Google Fotos.
Está bien para manejar los archivos de imágen.
Desde hace años usao esta app porque me permite organizar mis fotos como quiero y tambien permite cambiarlas de tamaño para marcos de fotos o para imprimirlas
Últimamente se queda congelada la pantalla de Shotwell y ya no me deja trabajar

Pues no soy profesional de la fotografía. Para lo que la uso está bien. Tiene las herramientas necesarias. Además, ordena las fotos por fechas. esto es útil cuando se tienen fotos de distintos dispositivos.
Super practica, sin tanto rodeos.

Es una excelente aplicación de administración de imágenes, pero en las dos últimas versiones de Ubuntu no me permite importar imágenes desde mi celular, me da el siguiente mensaje “La cámara está bloqueada por otra aplicación. Shotwell solo puede acceder a la cámara cuando está desbloqueada. Cierre cualquier otra aplicación que esté utilizando la cámara e inténtelo de nuevo.”

Espero que enmienden este error y que no se mantenga en el tiempo, de lo contrario me vería obligado a abandonarla, lo cual sería una pena. Tengo confianza en el el equipo d desarrollo resolverá este error.
summary: Es una excelente aplicación de administración de imágenes

description: Voilà un logiciel tout simple mais qui permet de ranger mes photos, images dessin de la plus simple manière. On peut aussi, entre autres, ajouter des étiquettes aux fichier facilitant ainsi la recherche par mots-clés.
oui super, mais je ne sais ce qui s'est passé un bug où ? toutes mes photo ont disparu, Elles ne se retrouvent même pas dans ma corbeille?e ne comprends rien Puis-je les récupérer et comment ? Merci

je ne comprends pas "fichiers manquants " 
je vois les photos mais je ne sais rien faire , sauf les supprimer , pourquoi ?
summary: super , sauf une question voir dessous

description: Pourquoi être obligé d'importer les photos? il serait bien plus economique et rapide de les visuliser sur les disques reseau....
c'est dommage que des option soi manquante
L'application me sert a jérer parfaitement mes photos.

Bien : facilité d'utilisation, retouches de base efficaces, liaison avec éditeur externe, diaporama, étiquettes hiérarchiques

Pas bien : la réorganisation des étiquettes par glisser-déplacer à la souris est fastidieuse dès que le nombre d'étiquettes dépasse la hauteur de l'écran - la sauvegarde de la base de données pourrait être automatisée.

Problème depuis Ubuntu 22.04 Shotwell plante régulièrement et peine à gérer mes milliers de photos.
summary: De grosses qualités, de gros défauts
